personality.title: Spider
personality.look: A giant spider walks boldly up to you, holding itself erect with arachnid poise and dignity. Then it scratches itself with one of its legs, spoiling the effect.
personality.name: "I'm Spider," it says proudly.
personality.job: "I'm the chief spider! I'm the leader!"

personality.title: Spider
personality.look: This spider had his multitude of eyes fixed on you in fascination. It takes a break from its web weaving to come over and speak with you.
personality.name: "Hi! My name's spider!"
personality.job: "Why, hmmm. I guess I make webs. And eat gnats. And think a bunch!"

personality.title: Spider
personality.look: A stern sentinel spider stands guard in this corridor. It doesn't seem inclined to let you pass.
personality.name: "I'm the guard spider. My name's Spider!"

personality.title: Spider
personality.look: This giant spider is a lot smaller than normal, only about the size of a large cat. It seems to find you fascinating.
personality.name: "I'm spider! Hi!"
personality.job: "I don't have a job. I'm just a baby, silly!"

personality.title: Spider
personality.look: You meet a spider with bad posture. It slouches through the caves in what you can only describe as a grumpy sort of way.
personality.name: It isn't quite as happy to see you as the other spiders. "I'm Spider."
personality.job: It makes a sort of a grumpy, high-pitched, squeaky, uncomfortable, cute sort of sound. "I walk around these caves and eat bugs. Whatever."

personality.title: Spider
personality.look: You see a visibly agitated spider. It's very shy, and looks very nervous.
personality.name: "I'm Spider," it says in a quiet squeak.

personality.title: Spider
personality.look: This spider is walking around, looking for a good place to set up a web. It stops to talk to you, but seems to be in a hurry.
personality.name: "I'm Spider," it says, while continuing to search.
personality.job: "I'm trying to make some webs. I'm hungry!"

node.text: "What?"
"I provide guidance and wisdom to all the other spiders."
It thinks for a while. "Hmm. Wisdom! Like, ummm ... don't eat each other. Make strong webs. Eat lots of yummy gnats. Don't play with evil things. That sort of thing."
"Webs are neat!"
"There's a bunch of gnats near here! They're yummy! They're mean and tough, though."
It looks at you nervously. "I'm not gonna' tell you that, silly! You'll eat our gnats, and we'll be all hungry and sad."

It strains its little spider brain trying to think what you're talking about. Finally, it remembers. "Oh, yeah! We had a pretty rock, but we lost it." It thinks. "Hey! I'll make a deal with you! If you get us some gnat eggs, we can help you out!"
"If you get them, we'll help you find the stone. First, though, you'll need the password to get to the gnats."

It strains its little spider brain trying to think what you're talking about. Finally, it remembers. "Oh, yeah! We had a pretty rock, but we lost it." It thinks. "Hey! I'll make a deal with you! If you get us some gnat eggs, we can help you out!"
"If you get them, we'll help you find the stone. First, though, you'll need the password to get to the gnats."
"Like the evil undead things to the west? They're nasty. They don't want to play or frolic or catch bugs or anything. They only want to hit us. How mean!"
"Yeah, that's the password! You can go by." It skitters away.
"I'm the one who tells the Great Story of our History! Or, if you don't want to hear it, we can discuss more personal things."
It sidles up close to you. "Has anyone ever told you how cute you are?"
It gives you a quick little kiss on the shin, and leers at you in an arachnid sort of way.
"Once upon a time, there were many smart humans in these caves. They held us here and talked to us a lot and prodded us and thought we were really interesting!"
"They gave us bugs, but not very yummy ones, and didn't let us build big webs, and kept us in small rooms and stuff. But then they all went away."

"They didn't know what to do with us, so they just opened our cells and left us to ourselves. So we got out and did a little happy dance." He demonstrates. "Then we can down here and were happy. Sort of. The end."
It thinks. "And you're cute."
"Yup! I keep people from reaching and eating our big, yummy bugs! To get by me, you have to give me the password."
"Bugs are yummy!"
"Yeah! The password! Did you forget it? It's ... " It stops. "Wait! You were trying to trick me! I'm not going to tell you what it is, silly!"
"Yum!"
"The password to get to the gnats is ..." It stops and looks around to make sure nobody is listening, and then move very close to you and whispers "Gnats."
"You're silly! But then, so are a lot of things, I guess."
"Yup. I'm all small and stuff. I can't even hunt my own food yet!"
"Soon I'll be all big and fierce, and can hunt!" It bares its fangs to you, which are currently a fairly impressive six inches long. "And I'll be able to pounce."
"I'm pounce fiercely. Want to watch me practice?"

It leaps forward about six feet, bounces off your shin, rolls backwards, accidentally sprays web all over itself, gets tangled, struggles to escape, gets itself more stuck, and finally rolls off down the corridor, a big round mass of goo and waving legs.
You sort of feel that its pounce needs work.
"Yeah. Bugs. It's what spiders eat. Silly." When this spider says you're silly, it doesn't seem as nice as when the other spiders do it.
"Yeah. Caves. That's all we ever are in. All the other spiders are so goofy, they never even try to see the outside."

"We are spiders! We should be finding our way outside, where we can eat all sorts of bugs, and bask in the sun, and build webs in the wind, and be happy. But the spiders are happy in their little caves, with bad, nasty undead around. It makes me angry."
"All they talk about is how cute things are."
"Well," it admits, "you are very cute. But that's besides the point."
"Yup. Let me show you." It waves its pedipalps in an agitated fashion, as a way of demonstrating its anger.
"A big nasty thing scared me!"
"Yeah. I was looking around around where the bad undead things are looking for neat stuff, and a big evil lizard ran by."
"Yeah. It was huge. And green. And it seemed really mad. It came by, and roared a lot, and ate a zombie, and was just really scary! So I came back here. I'm hiding."
"You should hide too. It was really, really big!"
"Webs are really, really tough to build. I wish we didn't have to make them, but that's the only way to catch those little, fast flying gnats. And those are the tasty ones!"

"Yeah. When we get hungry, we have to wait for gnats to fly in from the north and then try to catch them before they fly away. It's really tough, and there's not much time to flirt with all the other neat, cute spiders."
"Being a spider is very complicated. We have to make webs and find mates and raise little spiders. Plus we have all these legs to keep track of. It's tough!"
